English: Heliport
Later that day
Your patience paid off, comrades. It is time for you to finally get in the best gunship the Red Army has to offer.
Behold, Kamov V-80!
Yes! Finally!
We did it!
Are we going on a mission, comrade Syomin? Preferably right now?
Of course. It seems there might be a naval engagemtn off the coast of Kolguyev and we need to help.
Unfortunately, one of you has to stay here in reserve in case anything goes down on the island. We are the only combat ready squadron on the island at the moment. Choose between yourselves.
Hm... Ippolit, I think it should be...
Ippolit?!
Sorry, man, I need to fly this thing right now or I lose it completely! The next vodka is on me, I promise!
It might take hours before they come back. I should do something more useful than just standing around.
I should check on the helicopter, make sure everything is in order.\nI would not mind a second look at that machine anyway.
I also need to give my letter to the postmaster. And ask him about the lack of letters recently.
I have a letter to send. Here.
Another letter to Mother Russia, it shall be sent. Anything else?
Actually, yes. Have any new letters arrived recently?
Some, not so many lately though. Nothing for you, comrade Ablomov, sorry.
I am expecting an important letter. You are certain not one came in?
Yes, I am, I have nothing for you. I mean, you've been getting letters from the same address for a few months now.\nWhat could possibly be so important in this umpteenth one?
Have you ever fallen in love?
Hmph, no.
Then you wouldn't understand. I'll come by later.
Be my guest.
Properly oiled.. the engines are clean... All ammunition is in place...
Hm... is the fuel tank only half full? It should have been filled fully this morning
Someone from logistics slacked again...
My helicopter's fuel tank is only half full. There must have been a mistake.
Oh, right, we did have some trouble with the cistern. It's possible some of the vehicles might be lower on fuel.
Sounds like a problem to me.
Well, you're the first one to complain since morning.
Czech:
',logistics
STRM_35v31,I need it full in case of a long range flight."

English: Sure, I get that, but I am not authorized to give you fuel. You need to get permission from Borisov, my commanding officer.\nHe went on a walk to that chapel at the end of the road to the north and he did not take his radio with him.
You are kidding me, right?
Do I look like I am? Why the long face, it's a nice walk. Or you can borrow one of the cars if you're in a hurry.\nBut you're in reserve, so you ar e not.
What a joke. They fail to fill my fuel tank and I am the one to run around and demand they fix their fuck up. Towards the chapel, I guess.
Comrade Borisov I presume?
You presume right. What do you need of me?
Ablomov, air force. What are you even doing here, comrade?
This chapel is the northernmost point of the island. You can see the vast ocean sprawling into the distance and the calm waves bring peace to my mind. \nA good place to think.
I guess I see your point.
What do you need of me?
My fuel tank is only half full. I am in reserve and need it full in case of an emergency.
I see. Well, that's not a problem. I'll call it in and you should be good to go.
Call it in? They told me you don't have the radio with you.
We are in the middle of a war and near the front lines. I like my calm, but that is just silly. Get back to the airport, the fuel will be resolved.
I hate the guy.
KUZNETSOV, TAKE A CISTERN AND FILL UP THE RESERVE HELICOPTER. UPDATE THE INVENTORY WITH THE NEW VALUES. OVER.
UNDERSTOOD, COMRADE BORISOV. I'LL HANDLE IT RIGHT AWAY, IT WILL TAKE ONLY A MOMENT. OUT.
BUT IT WAS A NICE WALK, WASN'T IT? HA HA, SEE YOU AROUND, ABLOMOV.

FIREFLY TO ULYANA 1, WE'VE GOT A SITUATION. OUR FORCES IN LE MOULE REQUIRE AIR SUPPORT. THEY ARE BATTERED AND UNDER HEAVY ATTACK. ENEMY TANKS ARE COMING IN FROM MORTON. GET IN YOUR GUNSHIP AND HEAD SOUTH, THE TANKS NEED TO BE STOPPED BEFORE THEY GET TO OUR MEN IN LE MOULE. OVER.
ROGER THAT, FIREFLY. ULYANA 1 IS ON THE WAY. OUT.

FIREFLY TO ULYANA 1, INTEL REPORTS ANTI-AIR GUNS ARE AMONG THOSE TANKS. BE CAREFUL, YOU HAVE TO TAKE THEM OUT BEFORE THEY TAKE YOU OUT. THOSE MEN IN LE MOULE DEPEND ON YOUR HELP, YOU'RE THE ONLY ONE AVAILABLE. GOOD LUCK. FIREFLY OUT.
HOLD ON, MEN! THE GUNSHIP HAS ARRIVED! WE'RE GOING TO GET OUT OF HERE, DON'T WORRY!
ULYANA 1, THIS IS LEONID 1. I'VE GOT MANY WOUNDED HERE AND WE REQUIRE MEDICAL HELP. WE NEED YTOU TO KEEP THE ENEMY OFF OUR BACKS. OVER.
KIND OF HAVE MY HANDS FULL AT THE MOMENT, LEONID. HOLD ON DOWN THERE, STAY OUT OF LINE OF FIRE AND LET ME HANDLE THE REST. OUT.
ULYANA 1 TO LEONID, ALL ENEMY VEHICLES DESTROYED. WHATEVER'S LEFT IS SHATTERED AND ON THE RUN. OVER.
BLOODY WELL DONE, ULYANA. IT WAS GETTING REALLY HOT DOWN HERE. GOOD WORK! OUT.

FIREFLY TO ULYANA, WATCH OUT, ENEMY AIR ACTIVITY DETECTED SOUTH OF YOU. IT SEEMS THEY'RE SENDING IN HELICOPTERS. DO NOT LET THEM DESTROY OUR FORCES IN LE MOULE! YOU ARE OUR ONLY ANTI-AIR WEAPON IN THE ARE. GET RID OF THEM! FIREFLY OUT.
ULYANA TO LEONID, IT WILL BE HOT FOR A LITTLE WHILE LONGER. ENEMY GUNSHIPS ARE COMING. I WILL TRY TO TAKE THEM OUT BUT BE READY TO FLEE INTO THE FORESTS IF IT GETS TO IT.
WE TRUST YOU, ULYANA. GIVE'EM HELL!
FIREFLY TO ULYANA, YOU DID IT. THAT WAS SOME EXTRAORDINARY WORK YOU JUST DID. YOU ARE FREE TO RETURN TO THE AIRPORT. YOU MIGHT RECEIVE MEDAL FOR THIS, COMRADE. FIREFLY OUT.
THAT WAS INSANE, ULYANA, I'VE NEVER SEEN ANYTHING LIKE IT. WE OWE YOU BIG TIME. LOOK FOR LIEUTENANT RASHIV WHEN YOU GET BACK, I'M GETTING YOU SOME VODKA AT THE VERY LEAAST FOR THIS.
CAPTAIN ABLOMOV, IT'S BEEN A PLEASURE. I'M RETURNING TO THE AIRPORT, YOU TAKE CARE OF YOUR SQUAD, COMRADE RASHIV.
SEE YOU AROUND, COMRADE ABLOMOV, AND THANK YOU!
